summary: This document is a series of emails from August 2019 between FBI personnel coordinating the planning and logistics for a search warrant execution on Jeffrey Epstein's Little St. James Island. The emails discuss timelines, personnel, lodging, transportation, and coordination with other agencies like CBP and the US Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The target of the search warrant for his private island, Little St. James. The emails are planning the execution of that search.

events.title: Planned affidavit swearing for LSJ search
events.description: The SONY (likely a typo for SDNY - Southern District of New York) is drafting an affidavit for the search of Little St. James Island, with coordination to get it sworn out, likely on Thursday, August 8, 2019.

events.title: Planning for Epstein island search warrant
events.description: FBI New York and other personnel are actively planning the logistics for executing a search warrant on Jeffrey Epstein's Little St. James Island, including securing probable cause, transportation, lodging, and personnel.

events.title: Previous NYC residence search
events.description: Reference to a prior search warrant executed at Epstein's New York City residence, which initially was for pictures and proof of residency but expanded to a full search resulting in 845 pictures taken over 13 hours.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively planning a search of Jeffrey Epstein's private island, Little St. James, in August 2019.

The planning involved coordination between FBI New York, the US Attorney's Office (SDNY), Customs and Border Protection (CBP), and other law enforcement partners for logistics like transportation, lodging, and personnel.
A previous search of Epstein's NYC residence had yielded significant evidence (845 pictures) after the scope was expanded upon entry.
The document indicates an effort to isolate the 2019 case from the investigation into Epstein that occurred approximately 12 years prior.
Logistical challenges mentioned include limited lodging on St. Thomas due to a prior hurricane and the need to prepare for intense heat and humidity during the island search.
